channel.title: Help please
channel.description:
ok i know this doesn't belong in this section but i thought people from here will know what im talking about.. ok, my friend had sent me a autobot for rsc ( the real game ) and i decompressed it, then i tried running it and it said..... :confused: 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file...
can someone help me? ( in noob terms ) :confused:

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @spiritlord99 spiritlord99
item.description:
@spiritlord99 wrote:

Go to Mod taharoks tut in the tutorial section and download java, then try it…

Read full topic

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“camacamacamilia, post:15, topic:66133”][quote]Posted on: Today at 12:14:14 AMPosted by: BobDole81
Insert Quote
Use the “run server.bat”…it should work fine.

As for the batch commands I posted, if those don’t work it indicates problem with the java setup on your computer…
[/quote]
so whats that mean?[br][size=1]Posted on: March 11, 2007, 12:28:15 AM[/size][hr]this is what comes up when i do… [br][size=1]Posted on: March 11, 2007, 12:33:05 AM[/size][hr]ya sorry, but it still isnt working, can u post the variables that you have on your computer? maybe thats the problem, because ive seen like 5 diffrent ones…[/quote]
You need to Go to Start, Control Panel, Add Or Remove Programs find the newest java you have. and tell us what it is and we can help you.

Read full topic

so whats that mean?[br][size=1]Posted on: March 11, 2007, 12:28:15 AM[/size][hr]this is what comes up when i do… [br][size=1]Posted on: March 11, 2007, 12:33:05 AM[/size][hr]ya sorry, but it still isnt working, can u post the variables that you have on your computer? maybe thats the problem, because ive seen like 5 diffrent ones…

Read full topic

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Use the “run server.bat”…it should work fine.

As for the batch commands I posted, if those don’t work it indicates problem with the java setup on your computer…

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @camacamacamilia camacamacamilia
item.description:
@camacamacamilia wrote:

thanks, but that still dont work…[br][size=1]Posted on: March 11, 2007, 12:04:42 AM[/size][hr]heres the run server.bat java -cp "." Server pause

heres the run.bat java ProgramExecuter pause

here the programstart.bat java ProgramLauncher pause

if those need to be changed tell me please, lol

Read full topic

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Change it to:

@echo off 
title RuneScape Classic Compiling
echo Compiling BonjourScape Classic server
javac -cp . *.java 
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @camacamacamilia camacamacamilia
item.description:
@camacamacamilia wrote:

k thanks guys, ill try all those…[br][size=1]Posted on: March 10, 2007, 09:49:09 AM[/size][hr]ya, its still not working[br][size=1]Posted on: March 10, 2007, 10:32:38 AM[/size][hr]k this is the code thats under compile bat, idk if this will help but here is is…

@echo off title RuneScape Classic Compiling echo Compiling BonjourScape Classic server "C:\j2sdk1.4.2_04\bin\javac" -cp ../Classfiles -d ./Classfiles ./Javafiles/*.java pause

Read full topic

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @crazyboi50 crazyboi50
item.description:
@crazyboi50 wrote:

You either:

  1. Do not have java installed
  2. Do not have your environmental variables set properly. I believe if you look in the Rs2 Dev Help forum, you’ll find your answer to this problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @Jorsa Jorsa
item.description:
@Jorsa wrote:

and if that still doesnt work, make sure your variables are set to the right version.

Read full topic

item.title: Help please
item.dc:creator: @wooker wooker
item.description:
@wooker wrote:

[quote=“camacamacamilia, post:7, topic:66133”]sorry for the rudeness before, but i have installed the latest java and i have set the variables…i still have no idea what to do…[/quote]If your getting a ‘java’ is not recognised error, then what Bob said… Trry re-installing java, or re-setting your variables.

Read full topic
